$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.title: $:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver/plugin.info
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.text:
{
  "title": "$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver",
  "description": "Save TiddlyWiki to GitHub via Cloudflare Functions with password authentication",
  "author": "BenSweaterVest",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "core-version": ">=5.1.22",
  "source": "https://github.com/BenSweaterVest/tiddlywiki-cloudflare-saver",
  "plugin-type": "plugin",
  "list": "readme"
}

$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.title: $:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver/saver.js
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver/startup.js
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver/test-action.js
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver/settings
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.caption: CloudFlare Saver
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.text:
\define config-base() $:/config/cloudflare-saver/ !! ~CloudFlare Saver <$checkbox tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[enabled]] }}} field="text" checked="yes" unchecked="no" default="no"> Enable saving to Cloudflare Functions
Save your TiddlyWiki to GitHub via Cloudflare Functions with password authentication. Works as an additional save option alongside your existing save methods.
<$reveal state={{{ [addsuffix[enabled]] }}} type="match" text="yes" animate="yes"> !!! Cloudflare Function Endpoint URL <$edit-text tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[endpoint]] }}} field="text" default="" placeholder="https://your-site.pages.dev/save" tag="input" type="url" class="tc-edit-text"/>
The full URL to your deployed Cloudflare Function endpoint (e.g., `https://my-wiki.pages.dev/save`)
!!! Advanced Options <$checkbox tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[notifications]] }}} field="text" checked="yes" unchecked="no" default="yes"> Show save notifications <$checkbox tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[auto-retry]] }}} field="text" checked="yes" unchecked="no" default="yes"> Auto-retry failed saves (up to 3 attempts) <$checkbox tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[remember-password]] }}} field="text" checked="yes" unchecked="no" default="no"> Remember password during session
Password is stored in memory only and cleared on page reload. Only enable on trusted devices.
<$checkbox tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[debug]] }}} field="text" checked="yes" unchecked="no" default="no"> Enable debug logging to console !!! Request Timeout <$edit-text tiddler={{{ [addsuffix[timeout]] }}} field="text" default="30" tag="input" type="number" min="5" class="tc-edit-text" size="10"/> seconds
How long to wait for save requests before timing out (minimum 5 seconds)
!!! Setup Instructions <$details summary="Click to expand setup guide"> ''1. Create Cloudflare Pages Site'' # Go to [[Cloudflare Pages|https://pages.cloudflare.com/]] # Connect your GitHub account and create a Pages project from your TiddlyWiki repository # Deploy your site (e.g., `https://my-tiddlywiki.pages.dev`) ''2. Create GitHub Personal Access Token'' # Go to GitHub → Settings → Developer settings → [[Personal access tokens|https://github.com/settings/tokens]] # Click "Generate new token (classic)" # Select scope: `repo` (Full control of private repositories) # Copy the token securely ''3. Create Cloudflare Function'' Create a file at `functions/save.js` in your repository root. The complete, production-ready function code is available at: https://github.com/BenSweaterVest/tiddlywiki-cloudflare-saver/blob/main/demo/functions/save.js The function includes password authentication, rate limiting, content validation, retry logic, and proper UTF-8 handling. ''4. Set Environment Variables'' In Cloudflare Pages → Settings → Environment Variables → Production: |!Variable |!Type |!Description | |`GITHUB_TOKEN` |Secret |GitHub Personal Access Token (with `repo` scope) | |`GITHUB_REPO` |Text |Repository in format `username/repo-name` | |`SAVE_PASSWORD` |Secret |Password for authenticating saves | |`FILE_PATH` |Text |Path to TiddlyWiki file (optional, default: `index.html`) | |`MAX_CONTENT_SIZE` |Text |Max file size in bytes (optional, default: 52428800 = 50MB) | |`ALLOWED_ORIGINS` |Text |Comma-separated origins for CORS (optional, default: `*`) | Mark `GITHUB_TOKEN` and `SAVE_PASSWORD` as encrypted/secret variables. ''5. Configure and Test'' # Enter your Cloudflare Function URL above # Use the TiddlyWiki save button - you'll be prompted for your password # Check for success notification !!! Test Connection <$button class="tc-btn-big-green"> {{$:/core/images/save-button}} Test Cloudflare Save <$action-test-cloudflare/>
This will test your Cloudflare Function connection without triggering other savers. You'll be prompted for your password and will see a clear success or error message.

$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.title: $:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-saver/readme
$:/plugins/BenSweaterVest/cloudflare-sav.text:
!! Overview

This plugin enables saving your TiddlyWiki directly to a GitHub repository via Cloudflare Functions with secure password authentication, working as an additional save option alongside your existing save methods.

!! Key Features

* **Secure**: Password-protected saves with environment variable storage
* **Fast**: Serverless architecture via Cloudflare Functions
* **Reliable**: Built-in retry logic and comprehensive error handling
* **Responsive**: Visual notifications for save status
* **Configurable**: Comprehensive settings panel with debug mode
* **Compatible**: Works alongside existing TiddlyWiki save methods

!! Quick Setup

# Go to Control Panel → Saving tab
# Find the CloudFlare Saver section
# Enable saving to Cloudflare Functions
# Follow the setup guide to configure your Cloudflare Function endpoint
# Test the connection using the built-in test button

!! How It Works

This plugin adds Cloudflare saving as an additional option to your existing save methods. When enabled, you can save your TiddlyWiki through a Cloudflare Function that securely commits changes to your GitHub repository.

!! Support

For detailed setup instructions, troubleshooting, and support:
https://github.com/BenSweaterVest/tiddlywiki-cloudflare-saver

!! Version

Version 1.0.0 - Initial release with full functionality and comprehensive documentation.
